713299f-a.text:
W. 47th Street, at the S.E. corner of Eighth Avenue (right), showing a new 3 story tax payer after completion at this site. The Horn and Hardart Co. "Automat" will occupy most of the street floor, maintaining an L shaped restaurant.

June 6, 1929.
Albert Rothschild, photographer

710195f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue at S.E. corner of 47th Street, replacing three old houses, Nos. 760-766.
June 6, 1929.
Albert Rothschild.
Gift of F. P. Platt & Brothers.

710197f.text:
Eighth Avenue at S.E. corner of 47th Street, replacing three old
houses, Nos. 760-766.
June 6, 1929.
Albert Rothschild
Gift of F. P. Platt & Brothers.

713301f-a.text:
303-313 West 47th Street, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of
Eighth Ave.
June 21, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

710196f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, west side, north from a point to the south of West 47th Street. View No. 2 is photographed in the same direction from the S.W. corner of 47th Street.

Note the grilles in the pavement indicating the Municipal
Subway underneath ground.
June 21, 1935
Views: 1-2
P. L. Sperr

710196f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, west side, north from a point to the south of West 47th Street. View No. 2 is photographed in the same direction from the S.W. corner of 47th Street.

Note the grilles in the pavement indicating the Municipal
Subway underneath ground.
June 21, 1935
Views: 1-2
P. L. Sperr
